required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of LA-CEAL HALT COVID-19 Ambassador Program on Likelihood to Vaccinate
clinical_study.official_title: Louisiana Community-Engagement Alliance Against COVID-19 Disparities (LA-CEAL): Impact of HALT COVID Ambassador Program on Likelihood to Vaccinate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the effectiveness of the HALT COVID Ambassador educational outreach program on increasing likelihood to vaccinate against COVID-19

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators will use a randomized controlled trial to test the effectiveness of HALT COVID educational outreach by HALT COVID Ambassadors. HALT COVID Ambassadors will receive training to answer common vaccine questions & address misconceptions; conduct motivational interviewing; and implement basic behavioral economics and related strategies to remove barriers to vaccination. A random sample of FQHC patients will be identified in EHR data downloads of adult patients seen in the last year and contacted by telephone to gain consent and assess eligibility. A total of 100 individuals will be enrolled into the trial and randomized to intervention (engagement with the HALT COVID Ambassador over a 1 month period via in-person or virtual sessions exploring their own questions and concerns about vaccines) or usual care (no extra engagement). Baseline, 1-month, and 2-month follow-up surveys will assess for vaccine likelihood.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of participants "likely to vaccinate" between study arms at Month 1
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine likelihood will be measured using a single question adapted from the CEAL Common Survey (i.e., "On a scale from 1 to 7, with 1 being 'not at all likely' and 7 being 'very likely', how likely are you to get a COVID-19 vaccine in the next month?"), with "likely to vaccinate" defined as a score of 5-7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of participants "likely to vaccinate" between study arms at Month 2
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine likelihood will be measured using a single question adapted from the CEAL Common Survey (i.e., "On a scale from 1 to 7, with 1 being 'not at all likely' and 7 being 'very likely', how likely are you to get a COVID-19 vaccine in the next month?"), with "likely to vaccinate" defined as a score of 5-7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of participants who have received >=1 dose of vaccine between study arms at Month 1
secondary_outcome.description: Receipt of vaccination will be measured by self-report

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of participants who have received >=1 dose of vaccine between study arms at Month 2
secondary_outcome.description: Receipt of vaccination will be measured by self-report

intervention.description: 3-4 in-person or virtual engagements (individual or group sessions) over 1 month, each engagement lasting 30 minutes to 1 hour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unlikely to vaccinate in next month
- Age >=18 years
- Self-identification as Black or African American
- Ability to understand and speak English
- Willingness to engage with HALT COVID Ambassador via in-person or virtual sessions exploring questions and concerns about vaccines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable or unwilling to give informed consent
